description:
This is my favorite Chinese Restaurant by far! I've known the owners ever since I was 4 (17 years) and they make the best Won Ton soup. If you want food catered they have great prices just make sure to inform them at least a month in advance. 
On top of that they have a variety of food with huge portions. If it's your first time here or if you are a regular, 
I recommend to GET THE 
-Honey Walnut Shrimp (crunchy, flavorful, and soft on inside/ cooked perfectly with great sauce and real walnuts and honey)
-Salt & Pepper Pork Chops (tender on the inside, crispy on the outside, not that oily or too salty)
-Hong Kong Style Noodles (has vegetables and every meat imaginable with shrimp, this is worth it)
-Wor Wonton Soup Combination (same as the HK style noodles, has everything and great taste)

Tip:
-it gets busy in the noon time, try to come here for dinner or much earlier. 
-be patient with the customer service, it's a family owned business and she's getting old, really come here for the great food
-bring friends, you won't be able to finish 3 of the items I just listed by yourself, I recommend bring 3 or more people, everyone chips in about $10

This place really is a gem in SF and if you stumble upon a place like this you my friend are very lucky!
author: AJ M.

description:
The Chinese food we had at Wang wah
What's good quality and fresh the waitress been there for 30 years and each dish we had was a lot of food too much to eat but real good real good food I had a chicken fried rice sweet and sour chicken and beef and broccoli all for 10 bucks
author: Don H.

description:
Full disclosure: I went to school with the children of the owners, so I may be a little bias.

I ordered from them recently for a party I was hosting. It was really easy to call in the day before, and they can work with you on the amount of food. When they say enough for one person, they make the assumption that's all their eating. So if you order noodles for 15 people, you're literally getting enough noodles to fill 15 people up. 

I worked with them to make vegan noodles (rice noodle chow mien with no egg), as we had a vegan attending. It was cooked pretty well, and was very filling. 

Salt and Pepper Chicken wings: they're really good, but you need to eat them fast. Or maybe I needed to open the tin foil so it didn't steam. The fry is a little more like a thick batter (think beer batter). The chili peppers were delicious.

Mixed Veggies: I did say we had a vegan, right? They were really nice at figuring out how to make this one more substantial, and ended up adding tofu in the mix.

Overall, it was a pretty easy process. We had a ton of leftovers, though people were happy to take the rest. It's one of the best Chinese food spots on the Ocean Avenue corridor. 


Again, might be bias because I spoke to the owner in Chinese, and she kind of knew who I was because of her children. But. I do have to say it was easy even before I mentioned I knew their kids.
author: Lily W.

description: Amazing hole in the wall Chinese restaurant. food was great, workers were sweet. This place gets a lot of togo orders but have a seat, doesn't have music playing in the back but hey enjoy it a little! stop by, show some love :)
author: Sandy L.

description: This is the best hole in the wall. Every dish is amazing and it tastes so good! Not too oily and salty. My favorite is the scrambled eggs and beef over rice! Garlic green beans were delicious. And the spareribs with black bean sauce are to die for!!!!
author: Lily L.

description: I wish I could give this place 6 stars. Best Chinese restaurant in the neighborhood. They have an extensive menu, so they are bound to have whatever you are craving. The couple that owns/operates the place is fantastic. Awesome food, huge portions and great prices. What could be better.
author: Alex S.

description:
Was pleasantly surprised to find pretty great Chinese food here. I have been living in the area for the past 10 years, and have probably passed this place many times while walking on Ocean Ave, never bothered giving it a chance. My family and I were lazy to cook and decided to check out this small place, and we will definitely be back.
It doesn't get too cramped in here as most people tend to get their orders to go. Love that they offer free soup with the meal. Everything we had was delicious! I don't think you can go wrong with any dish you order. Plus the prices are super reasonable ! We got three dishes for under $30. 
I'll definitely be back esp on those days I'm too lazy to cook.
author: Wendy L.

description: Went here post yoga.  My wife got the clay pot and it was really good.  Food was so much more flavorful here than I get in Chicago.  Service was typical Chinese restaurant and if you don't like somewhat grubby conditions skip it but then you won't be eating good Chinese!
author: Jeff C.

description: Best quantity of Chinese food, I usually get the Mongolian beef chow mein !!! I come here at least twice a week for lunch.
author: Mike T.

description: Haven't been to Wang Wah (Golden China) for years and noticed they remodeled the entire restaurant after the fire next door. I was surprised the lady owner of this place still recognized my face after all these years right when I walked into the restaurant and asked how my family was doing. This is the typical mom and pop business with family members helping out in the back. We ordered Pork Chops and Ong Choy which came with soup and rice. The owner is very nice and will make you feel like you're at home. For the regulars, the owner will remember everyones orders, I would never need to look at the menu when I eat here. I also noticed the owner will go out of her way to the grocery store next door to buy ingredients that they ran out for a customers dish. That is dedication right there for the loyal customers. Overall good Chinese food for the price and good service.
author: Peter C.

description: Serving sizes are huge, yet this is the lowest-priced Chinese food menu I have come across. I've only been once, but I did NOT have any dishes that had a big puddle of fatty brown sauce at the bottom. I'd say the food is slightly above average for this type of Chinese-American-style cuisine. It IS a funky little place, so if you need ambience, better to order to go.
author: Buzz B.

description: Second time I ordered delivery and second time they got it wrong. Doesn't matter if the food is good if they can't get your order right.
author: LH H.

description:
The food, the smell coming from the kitchen, even the way this place looks reminds me of my aunt's house where everyone got together. That was the place I would take my shoes off, wear someone's ugly sweater, drink some random soupy medicine stuff I'm forced to drink lest I die a premature and painful death before laying on the sofa with the "clink clink" sound of MJ tiles on the tables lulling me to sleep before waking to an abundance of lovingly cooked food on the dinner table. 

The meals I have had here transported me to that place. Certain types of home style cooking does that to me. Interestingly enough, this isn't my home, and these wonderful people aren't my family. 

My photographs speak to what I ordered. It was really affordable despite ordering ala carte instead of their inexpensive pre-set menus for groups of 2 or 4. 

This isn't a fancy restaurant by any means. The food will not resemble mass produced gross Panda Express or Westernized watered down weird versions of Chinese food. No, this restaurant does it the way it should be done. 

I like that. I like that a lot 

DON'T ORDER THE WON TON SOUP! It wasn't good, which makes me sad because the owner gave us an extra family sized bowl while we waited for the whole fried fish. 

I'm so happy I found this place. I am happy I got to enjoy a delicious dinner with my girls. I think we all need to find that one place that we can sit down and eat a fuss free meal that makes us feel ...like home. 

My initial visit was for family dinner. I visited several times after that to pick up lunch specials that are delicious and inexpensive!

If you are in the neighborhood, stop by or phone your order in for pickup. 

Ah - one last important detail: NO MSG.
author: Jennifer C P.

description:
The woman is very friendly and gives you big servings for a low price. They also take requests when you don't want certain things on your food such as animal products if you're vegan.
Would recommend!
author: Zoenoel C.

description: Best Chinese food in the neighborhood. I've been here 13 years and eaten at a lot of the local spots but this one is consistently delicious as well as affordably priced. The sesame chicken and egg rolls are especially good.
author: M K.

description:
Came here for Togo
Service is super fast 

The owner she's very nice 

We ordered beef and tomato 
Egg and tomato 

Both came our perfect 

Will be back soon
author: Mack A.

description:
I was really craving some noodles when I was passing through town. A quick search on the app, it brought up this place. I didn't expect much when I showed up, and I wasn't wrong. I ordered the roasted duck, wonton hoa fun. The roasted duck was ok, a little on the fatty side. The wontons were a little off tasting though. The hoa fun was the best part, but you can't mess up noodles. The broth was a little boring. It tasted like plain vegetable broth. 

If I was in a pinch, I would come here, but this wouldn't be my first choice.
author: Vicky L.

description:
Cheap lunch combos. Bbq pork fried rice + brocolli beef + egg roll + 2 fried shrimp for $7.55 total.

Came here at 11.40am and it was packed with chinese men...no women in sight  I guess for the big portions they give, it's worth the money.

Food to go was very fast although they were really busy. The old chinese woman that helped me was very efficient, took my order w/out any rudeness whatsoever.

Restroom inside. Free 2 hr parking around the neighborhood.

Will be coming back!
author: Inez J.

description: 5-star for what you paid for and what you get. Cheap delicious Chinese food, it's one of those low-key Chinese take out places that satisfies your need right away . Ordered the beef n broccoli lunch entree and it was ~$7 all in . Portion was big, I was completely full after, and the price was exactly what I would pay. I recommend this place!
author: Clint S.

description: I live nearby and have came to this place more than one year. Everything taste so good and price so good. Food store 92. This is a place to get real Chinese food daily.
author: Fangfang O.

description:
Have been for dim sum a couple of times.

Everything, including service, has been good to excellent.  

During our last visit we had warm baked dessert bows fresh from the oven.  Slight crunch to the crust, smooth melt in your mouth finish inside.  Both flavors were so good I could have finished them all myself.

Will return.
author: Saul M.

description:
Friendly, hardworking family owned establishment that embodies the definition of cheap, good chinese food. Large quantities for each dish. 

I work at a store nearby and they always offer to carry it over to me when I'm working.
author: Staly C.

description: My new go- to spot for dinner! The food was delicious and fresh. The menu has so many options that I want to come back and try more. The value is incredible and the portion sizes are huge. I left with lots of leftovers. The service is also great. I highly recommend!
author: Kathryn S.

description: I ordered the chicken with vegetables and filet of sole with vegetables for 4 people as a takeout. While it tasted delicious, 3 out of 4 of us were on the toilet within a few hours (I didn't get sick, although stomach was a little gurgly). I don't know if it was the MSG or what. The general presentation of the restaurant is junky and cluttered in the back of the store: an employee is cutting vegetables less than 10 feet from diners! I wasn't impressed, and I won't be back. This place was far better as "Golden China" 10-20 years ago before the name and ownership changed hands.
author: Maurice R.

description:
After reading some Yelp reviews and seeing the killer lunch deal, I decided to get the takeout lunch special that has chowmein, sweet and sour pork, an egg roll and 2 deep fried shrimp for like $6. The portion was ENORMOUS (mostly chow mein) and I ate way less than a quarter of it. The chowmein was way too greasy, and the sweet and sour pork didn't taste very good. I wasn't a fan. The egg roll had a weird smell to it, like over used grease maybe. 
It seems that they do have fans though, because when I went to pick up my food, the restaurant was pretty crpwded with Asian construction dudes chowing down. So who knows.
I don't eat Chinese food too often but if I crave it at lunch again, there are a ton of other options in this neighborhood that I would try first.
author: Liz M.

description: I love it here! My friend introduced me to this place and I have been coming here for years! Friendly owner great food! This is my go to place and I definitely recommend that other people come here!
author: Yarithza F.

description:
I'm updating my review because I came back for the beef chow fun and tofu and beef over rice. Super yummy. I guess the last time was simply a fluke. I'll admit it does smell a bit odd in there, but the food is good so oh well. 

Also, either they r over charging me a bit or the prices displayed on the Yelp menu are are incorrect. I'm going to give Wang Wah the benefit of the doubt and say the menu prices are wrong.
author: Elaine S.

description: This has got to be one of the CUTEST mom and pop restaurants. It's very small so it's easy to miss but the lady (whom I'm going to guess is the owner) is so so so incredibly sweet! I wish them nothing but the best!!
author: kelly l.

description: After searching Yelp reviews for decent Chinese restaurants in the area, we settled on this one. Not disappointed at all. If my memory serves correctly, (we came back in November 2016) we ordered war wonton soup, shrimp fried rice, fried tofu, salt and pepper pork chops, fried wings, and more. The food was quite delicious and even pleased the palette of my honey's picky 6 year old great niece. The staff was kind and the service was quick...they made sure to stop by often to offer more tea and check-in with us. Looking forward to returning the next time I'm in the area!
author: Ursula R.

description:
Hands down my favourite restaurant in Ocean Ave, the food is delicious and HUGE portions! I've been here for the past week straight for dinner and I love practising my Cantonese whilst waiting for my order!

The char sui chow mein is top notch! 

M'goi sai!
author: William M.

description: got food for my mom birthday party. the owner was really sweet and food was later consumed by all. will definitely be back
author: Kat V.

description: A little dingy on the inside, but I love this place. Their food is very good with surprisingly good cuts of meat. Great selection, affordable, convenient, and quick to order take out. All you could ask for in a Chinese restaurant!
author: Jeremy P.

description: This place is right on point. I get my food quick and fast. The lady that runs this spot is super cool and thoughtful. She always knows my voice when I call and never has me waiting any longer than 5 minutes for my food. I have been coming here for 5 years now and the prices are extremely reasonable. I usually get the Mongolian beef and it is always fresh. If you're looking for something quick an inexpensive then hit this spot during the early afternoon or around dinner time.
author: Robert F.

description: Good food at reasonable prices. The portions are very generous, and the staff is top notch. The restaurant is very small, but it's clean.
author: Malcolm G.

description:
There are so many little Chinese cafes on Ocean Ave that it can be hard to distinguish one from the other. This place is my go-to takeout place. It's a total hole in the wall but the food is always fresh, good, and a total value.  Love the hot and sour soup and wonton noodle soups. Also the green beans are a favorite and they use actual chopped garlic vs the jarred stuff! Ask them to make it spicy with pork. So gooood.

Can't say much for ambience but you can get tasty, reliable Chinese food here. They serve Cantonese, Schezuan and Hunan style food.
author: Dora L.

description: Excellent casual Chinese; friendly, family style restaurant. Everything we had was delicious.
author: M W.

description:
Went here base on yelp reviews. Sorry I did, won't be returning. Order my kids favorite salt pepper pork chop. Kids took one bite & said they didn't like it. I tried a piece and the pork had that spoil taste. Nasty. 

Order the Beef Stew  with turnip in hot pot. Order came in a regular bowl not clay pot . There was maybe 3 pieces of beef & the rest was turnip. Was expecting a hot pot dish. False advertisement.

Sorry for the bad review, as the only good was the waitress/owner was nice. But that didn't make up for the food or portion. .
author: Unus U.

description: Not too shabby for something close when I don't feel like going to my usual spots. Best thing I've had isn't even on the menu, but they'll make you salt and pepper fish if you ask. Delicious! Highly recommend. Otherwise the BBQ pork fried rice is also good, the General Tao chicken tasted more like sweet and sour chicken, which was good if I wanted sweet and sour, potstickers were eh and the rangoons were literally empty inside (see photo).
author: Bernadette R.

description:
If I can put zero stars, I really would..

If you are NOT Chinese, do not come here. Let me say that again, IF YOU ARE NOT CHINESE, DO NOT COME HERE. My best friend and I come in, was stared at by the people working here, but not seated right away. When we finally got seated, we didn't get a menu, instead we stood up and got a menu ourselves since the waitress just kept passing our table like no one was sitting there. As soon as we were ready to order, we called on the waitress, but we were told to WAIT since a CHINESE man just walked in, was brought to his table immediately and given tea and the menu. Wtf. Worst service ever. We ended up leaving and going to the Chinese place next door where we were helped immediately.
author: Candee D.

description: We are regulars here. Love the duck with vegetables and the chicken corn soup. More than that we love the Aunty who owns the place. She remembers tiny details about us which makes us feel deeply connected to her and the food that we order.
author: Gitanjali R.

description: Went here with my family and again with my girlfriend, the food in my opinion is way above average in a homestyle sense. The lady was very kind to us on both occasions and the food came out in record time! Cheap, delicious, and comforting; will be coming back.
author: Kevinn L.

description:
I live a block away and always order carryout from this place. Huge portions, cheap price and tastes good! 

It's also super close to the local dispensary so its perfect for some scrumptious munchies.

My personal favorites (Cheap and delicious): Salt and Pepper Chicken Wings, Any of the Pan Fried Noodles (crunchy noodles with a lot of meat), Beef Stew Wonton Noodle Soup
author: Antonio T.

description: My cousin came here with me after working and I wasn't even that hungry but I was like ehh sure why not. She came here so many times the lady that owns this place recognizes her. We ordered sweet and sour chicken, sweet and sour seafood soup, and spareribs with taro plate with some white rice. Food came one plate at a time of course the soup comes first traditionally in Chinese restaurants or food places. The soup was a way too sour and it wasn't super spicy which I wish it was more spicier. It didn't have much seafood in it as well. The taro plate tastes really mushy and the spareribs had no meat on it whatsoever. The sweet and sour chicken tastes like fish instead of chicken and it wasn't crispy nor does it have the good sweet and sour taste to it. Just tastes like jarred sweet and sour sauce. Overall I would come here if everywhere around is closed or packed if I'm in this area. I don't think I'll come back or come here often just because the food isn't all that. The prices are pretty low and decent for the amount you get so at least that's the good part.
author: Lisa W.

description:
Wang Wah, what can I say. Truly, a great place to eat for lunch and dinner. Authentic Chinese food that offers a rich selection of variety and taste. Comfort food at its core and very fulfilling as well! If you get the letter orders (F, G, H, J, etc), you get fried rice or chow mein, chicken/pork/beef, and usually prawns with an egg roll. It's like Panda Express on steroids. The presentation looks similar but the quality and taste is much better. Certainly a place where you can feast.

I used to get the letter orders but now I do family style because I want to tone it down. Keep in mind that Wang Wah tends to get busy during lunch time as the construction workers start piling in. But they have ample seating and to-go is also not a bad idea. 

If you go here, you will find yourself coming back again -- and that is okay. Just make sure you are hungry because you will be eating a lot!
author: Phillip K.

description: My go to place for lunch. They have the best lunch specials. The honey walnut shrimp is delicious and so is the chow mein. The crab wontons aren't like regular ones since there isn't any cream cheese in it so it tastes a little to fishy.
author: Vika N.

description: Crab Rangoon were just empty fried wontons, no filling. General Tso's chicken was just sweet n sour, wonton noodle soup was just wontons boiled in tap water with noodles thrown in. Will not eat here again.
author: James S.

description: Super nice lady owner!  She remembered my previous orders, although I only took two or three take-outs in a year or so.  Unbelievable.  Pretty tasty, huge portions, rock-bottom prices, ready to pick up in 10 minutes.  Very handy if you are in the area and crave something Chinese.  Honest, hard working neighborhood joint.
author: Lana L.

description:
This place is by far, the cheapest yet most satisfying Chinese restaurant on Ocean Ave. Yes, I'm dissing you Emmy's and Joe's!! haha

Big portions and really good chinese take out place.

Yesterday, I ordered the honey walnut prawns w/ fried rice. It's a combination item that has loads of chicken fried rice. 

Truly a bang for your buck!

I can't believe that it has been closed for more than a year. Moreover, I can't believe it's recently reopened for 2 months now too. lol

Definitely a fan... going back there tonight. haha

P.S For phone orders, make sure they understand you, I've always had to problem of them not really messing up, but still something is missing... like Make it hot and spicy - i got no spiciness etc.
author: Jan R.

description: This has been my favorite place for about a year so far. If you like a relaxing and quiet atmosphere, this place is for you! The food is always fresh and yummy and the prices are reasonable too. The lady that works there always remembers what I like to get, so every time I walk in, she says, "Hi! Shrimp fried rice for here?" And I say, "Yes." The fact that she always remembers what I usually get is amazing and makes me feel welcomed all the time!
author: Kseniya K.

description: The place is good because it's fast, big servings and clean. Food was very whatever. Not cool that Server kicked me out when I was just packing up bag to leave. I saw she didn't do the same for the construction workers that surrounded me.
author: Cate R.

description:
There's a few eateries on Ocean so you always have something new to try and recently I've been coming to Golden China. 

I've had the house wonton soup, shrimp fried rice, wings, S&P pork chops, and S&S chicken. 

House wonton soup is a filling soup for about $7. I will be coming back on a rainy day. Wings and pork chops are standard, I get this with the fried rice as a combo. They have a lot of combo specials under $10 so that's why it's become one of my regulars. 

In terms of ambiance, it's your typical Chinese restaurant. Could use a English-speaking front person, some tidying up, and keeping storage hidden from customers but overall not bad. I've had better, but the combo specials have generous portions so I can count on them to fill me up. It's ran by two sweet Asian ladies too so reminds me of home.
author: Tee T.

description: This place is consistent with making delicious Chinese food at extremely affordable prices. Plus, they always serve a mountain of food whether you dine-in or order to go. Customer service is great! Juan remembers the orders of returning customers, and that makes me feel appreciated and understand she's dedicated to providing the best customer service. My family and I have eaten here many times in the past and will continue returning!
author: Stacey P.

description:
Reminds me of home cooking. 

Simple but delicious dish of Yam leaves ( Chinese water spinach ).

We usually enjoy the Peking spareribs, tomato beef chow mein and chicken and green beans.
author: T L.

description:
Yesterday, I walked into Golden China Restaurant on Ocean Ave., SF for a quick lunch. The sign outside said "Grand Opening". I stood at the front for several moments and waited to be seated. The place was very full. All of the patrons were Chinese, so I figured this was a great place. I was completely ignored, so I sat myself at a vacant table. I noticed first off, that the table was sticky and filthy, and looked like it had never been truly disinfected or really cleaned. The grouchy older Chinese lady, who was waiting tables came over and said, "One?", and I replied yes. She gave me a dirty look and stormed away, wiping another table with a dirty rag!! 

I began to look at the condiments on the table in a basket. They were all FILTHY and disgusting, and looked like they had not been washed or refreshed in YEARS. It made me sick at my stomach. Meanwhile a young Chinese couple came in and sat at the only other open table. The grouchy Chinese lady immediately brought them tea! I said to myself, "I don't ever want to even walk into this filthy, unfriendly place again, and hurried out.
author: Nancie M.

description: solid chinese food, good prices
author: Long C.

description:
Everyone has their own favorite hole in the wall Chinese neighborhood restaurant. 

You know the one where you'll pickup some chow mein, beef chow fun, and won ton soup. The one you'll pickup on the way home from after a long Monday at work, or on Saturday night when you're just lounging around in your pajamas and don't feel like cooking or changing out of your pajamas. 
. 
Golden China is exactly that type of restaurant. However, it isn't mine. I's my grammas who lives right up the street. 

Back in the days, If she wasn't home cooking some Flip food, she'd pickup some house special chow mein for me and my little cousins. I can't remember how the chow mein was back then, but I can say that their chow mein now is super good. So good that I didn't get a chance to take a pic of the takeout I brought back to her. I did get a picture of their beef chow fun which was on point. http://static3.px.yelp.com/bphoto/PEf6wA25C9ioyy8EmEQCKQ/l It wasn't to greasy, the noodles had a good texture and still very hot from the walk back. I'm not sure how authentic it was but it was sure comforting for a foggy city night .
author: Earl G.

description: Wang Wah is life! I go here all the time and the woman treats us like family. Other Chinese restaurants treat Black people differently, she doesn't! It's relatively cheap, you get huge portions, and everything is made when you order it. ALWAYS choose this over Panda Express. I've been going here since I was five now and it will always hold a special place in my heart.
author: Nia B.

description: Many selections, mostly deep fried items,  just an Okay "American" Chinese Food. The restaurant is very small, disorganized and they don't have ice for drinks.  They don't delivery but I think it's just good for pick up.
author: Brady A.

description:
So, so, so happy that they reopened. It is definitely the best takeout place in the area. The food is good, the portions are huge, the prices are cheap, and service always comes with a smile :)

They've done some massive remodeling. The floors are new, the appliances are new, the furniture is new. It looks great!
author: Wendy S.

description:
I would say the perfect way to describe this place would be Americanized Chinese with Large portions at great prices!

Ive only been here once, last week, but I've heard they recently remodeled and its nice.

I like that they have forks placed at your table, and you if you want chopsticks you can ask for them. 

I went for dinner and the service is slow. Only one waiter. Alot of folks were getting their food to go, I might do that next time. I think it might be different during lunch.

Foods okay, well worth it, and lots of bang for your buck, they have Great "Hot & Sour soup."

I think it might be the best Chinese in that area.
author: Isiah B.

description:
I've only been to this restaurant once and that was for a to-go order.

Pros: Nice and clean appearance, quite restaurant, friendly cashier/hostess
Cons: Restaurant is on the small side, portions are off, meat fridge in main dining room

My parents wanted to try their 3/$18.99 dinner menu and so we ordered for togo. Based on first impressions, I was not disappointed with what I saw. It is very clean and very quiet. The menu itself looked decently priced but then we can't really say until we see what the actual finished product comes out to be. The 3/$18.99 menu was very limited. There were maybe a little over 10 items to choose from, all which sounded like hit or miss dishes. My sister and I ended up picking the seafood tofu, Szechuan sauce with chicken, and Mongolian beef. The  time it took to get our food was maybe 15 minutes which was not bad. The food came out piping hot. When we got home to try the food, I was a little disappointed in the portions we received. They appeared to be nice and full but the seafood tofu was 90% tofu, the Szechuan chicken was 50% chicken/50% onions, and the Mongolian beef was in a measly takeout box.

All in all, I would definitely consider eating here more and sampling more of their menu. They have tons of specials that do not sound half bad. My advice would be to just try sitting as far away as you can from the cash register because the meat freezer seemed to be just a few feet back from there.
author: Alex T.

description:
Recently, I resurrected my visits here.  After the fire next door and their remodeling, I returned to order the nostalgic bliss I experienced before.  Sadly, things have changed for the worse. 

The main Hostess knows me.  Amidst all Staff, she's the most 'fluent' one.  She also recalls my herbivorous needs and preferences even now.  I ordered my usual mixed veggie w/ shiitake  mushrooms over rice plate. Very generous with all ingredients and doesn't exceed $6. I also reordered a specialized request of hot and sour soup, made w/ no meat or meat broths/remnants.  This time, the soup made me sick to my stomach. 

Woke up 4 hours after ingestion singing the soup to the potty.  Returned the next morning to inform the Hostess.  Kindly let her know w/o accusations of using rotten ingredients while also complimenting her about the rice plate, then and now, as its never nauseated me.  Still, got scolded by her and the Fry Cook as though I'd accused them of using spoiled ingredients.  Got put on stand like I was at trial and battered w/ how 'No other customers got sick or made complaints.' I reminded her likely none of their customers are herbivores and ever makes custom requests to that liking. I repeated myself about how the dish didn't make me sick, only the soup. They insisted they put 'tofu and no meat.'

The restaurant is small and by the cash stand in the back, you can look right into the kitchen.  I don't doubt they use 'relatively' fresh ingredients but when I see a large can of powdered chicken stock (likely loaded w/ MSG) right next to the stoves, I also know their raw ingredients are showered w/ other processed, unnatural flavorings.  Who am I to complain though?  I came back, right?  Well, I only complain when I'm up at 2am hollering into the toilet.  

Ultimately, Hostess was nice enough to refund me for the soup despite her and the Fry Cook's bickering and resistance to apologize or simply offer reconciliation.  Not too surprising as all the Staff are essentially peasants w/ limited English.
author: Honest J.

description: 5 for value alone.. True chinese spot with usual menus and killer lunch combos. Quick service, fresh food, great time... Always
author: Stinky B.

description: Customer service alone this lady be on point.  Im a first timer her but watching her take care of everyone in the restaurant and remembering peoples orders is amazing.  For the food, I wouldnt exactly say magical, but def filling and decently priced.  Would definitely be coming back.
author: Daniel W.

description: My husband and I ordered chicken lo mein, sweet and sour chicken, and an order of egg rolls, and all 3 items were not edible.  We threw it away after one bite of each.  The lo mein noodles were angel hair spaghetti noodles with a pile of bok choi on the top.  The sweet and sour sauce on the chicken tasted like chemicals.  Will NEVER go here again.  Don't waste your time or money!
author: Crystal L.

description: I stopped ordering from here b/c nothing I'd ordered ever tasted right anymore and it was clear they were cutting corners in all the wrong ways like skimping on ingredients - those huge portions of fried rice and chow mein are no deal if all they're ALL just rice and noodles mostly - and using ingredients that are beyond fresh - the soups always smell and taste funky.
author: Rose B.

description: Please do yourself a favor and go to McDonald's because that is what I did after ordering a rice dish to go just now. This place is beyond horrible! Do not even step foot in this place. $8.00 for sauce and rice, no meat!!! You better throwing your money away!
author: Curtis C.

description: don't know how this place can get a four star.   it's the worst Chinese restaurant i have eve had in my life.  it's not cheap, came out 8 something .  i ordered combo.   the box is filled up with fried rice with tiny, boiled shrimp, it's not well fried at all, no taste, pretty much just leftover rice tossed with soy saouce.   i through away the whole thing in dumpster.
author: Lucy J.

description: Best chinese food on Ocean Ave hands down.
author: Ryan M.

description:
The food there was great.  I miss this place (got burned down as a casualty to a fire two doors down - hope they come back)

The Combination Egg Foo Young was off the hook, incredible; same for the Mongolian beef and the chow mein.

My whole family and their families went here for years... hope you come back.
author: Pablo H.

description: If you live in the area and are craving Chinese, this is where you should dine or order takeout from. You can really tell everything is fresh from the slices of ginger to the seafood. I ordered Prawn Chow Fun and it blew Panda out of the water. Their meatless orange chicken is also delicious! I highly recommend it! This is authentic, reasonably-priced Chinese food that comes in enormous portions!  Do yourself a favor and try it.
author: Isaiah G.

description: No delivery, even though Yelp profile shows Yes. Food OK, not bad, a little bland in flavor to an American palette. Quick service, reasonable prices, good size portions.
author: A V.

description: I would have liked to have ordered from this restaurant but delivery is CASH ONLY! Just know before you order everyone. Happy eating!
author: veronica b.

description:
I am very very happy to see this restaurant open again. They were closed down for a while after a neighboring shop had a fire and subsequently burn them out of their place. Prior to the fire this location was pretty run down and you would question the safety of the food. However the food was always hot tasty and I never had any problems. Now that they've been renovated everything is nice and clean the walls are painted and the appliances are new. The owner is great she's nice as always and always has a smile when you order something from her.

I have been to my fair share of Chinese restaurants in Chinatown and other cities and in San Francisco. Their food is on par with some of the better dishes that I've tasted that other restaurants that cost a lot more. My favorite dishes are the beef stew and the shrimp with walnuts. 

They have really great rice plates and lunch specials along with great soup service and flavor. This is my go to Chinese restaurant in the neighborhood. That is saying a lot considering there are at least 10 other Chinese restaurant on Ocean Avenue. Golden China is the one for me and I wouldn't go anywhere else.
author: Jesson d.

description:
Went there for the first time tonight for dinner.

Small place but it doesn't seem it ever gets too crowded as a lot of people seem to order to go and or pick up.

Food was decent, was pretty much expecting Chinese Fast food which is what I got. I love that they have combo dishes (sweet/sour chicken, fried rice, and an egg roll for example). 

Portions are enormous and price is significantly affordable. Servers are nice.

Critiques:
Sweet & Sour Chicken- Came with very little sauce so it was like I was eating chunks of fried chicken.

Beef & Broccoli- Drowning in sauce, wouldn't recommend it.

I'd recommend this place if you are really hungry but aren't looking to spend a lot of money.
author: Alejandro T.

description:
This is one of those places where you can't judge a book by its cover. From the outside, the Golden China aka Wang Wah doesn't look like much, the inside isn't impressive at all either. However this place is very affordable (about $5.00- $10.00 pp) and the food and service were great. 

My friends and I went out for Chinese last night. One of my friends yelped the neighborhood looking for restaurants on her phone and we were off to try the Golden China restaurant. 

We ordered Honey Walnut Prawns with Chicken Fried Rice, Beef Chow Fun and Kung Pow Chicken. They served us complimentary Won Ton soup and tea while we waited. The dishes came out and they were huge! We ended up taking home two big boxes of leftovers. We could have served 5 people for the amount of food and that was a great value. 

I'm giving this place 4 stars based on the taste and value. It's always nice to know a friendly, tasty and inexpensive restaurant, so bookmark it and give it a try.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
Fail.. I really don't get the rave reviews. I tried this place for lunch the other day as I was over on that side of the city and yelp reviews were good. I would NOT return. I was going to order a particular lunch special and the waitress steered me to another one (shouldn't have listened) because the one I was selecting had no rice.. she said you want rice. I was in a hurry and given all the raves I thought fine I'll take her guidance. 
The food: the plate was 80% rice.. a huge mound of flavorless rice with two small portions of broccoli beef and sweet and sour chicken. The chicken was almost inedible - so dry. The broccoli beef was heavy on the sauce and the broccoli itself looked like something I would compost, yellowing on the side so very not fresh. I ate about 1/5 of the food and couldn't handle more so I paid and left.
author: Susannah M.

description: Great place to go when you are feeling lazy and don't wanna cook. Front desk ladies are very nice. Food is delicious and HUGE portion.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Location:  Right on Ocean, easy to find. I stumbled across this place walking home from the bank.

Initial Reaction: Standard Chinese restaurant, nothing to get excited or complain about. I do sense a bit of humidity, which is probably due to the steam from the kitchen. This could explain why it feels sticky on the table and/or condiments. 

Services/Food Purchased: I purchased Bittermellow with Spare Ribs on white rice. 

Time of Service: Very fast, well within standard expectations

Customer Service: There was nobody there when I first walked in. The ladies didn't speak English very well and handed me a menu. Again, standard Non native English speaker service. It wouldn't be fair to compared them to a big box American restaurant in terms of service, but then again you're there for the food. 

Value: I paid 7 dollars for my meal. The portion was good and the food tasted fresh. It's neither expense or budget friendly. 

My 2 Cents: This is a standard Chinese restaurant. The service is OK (you would need to flag them down if you want help or service), the place looks OK and nothing really exciting about their menu. What I would say is that their cooking is authentic and I wouldn't mind going there again. I wouldn't make a special trip just to eat there however. But this is still much better than panda express. 

3/5
author: Steven Z.

description: My fav here is their salted fish with chicken fried rice. They cook it the way I wanted it and took it up a notch by optional request to add more garlic, ginger and green onion.  So heavenly flavorful, no other side dish is needed. Ever since then when I come or make a phone order they knew exactly how to cook it to my desire.
author: Kru X.

description:
Been here twice since the reopening, blown away both times. Prompt service, delicious food, large portions and low prices. It's now my Chinese restaurant of choice!

I recommend the fried prawns, fried wantons and garlic spinach.
author: Ehsan M.

description: I wish I could speak Cantonese, or Mandarin perhaps.  It would be a trip to be able to stroll into Wang Wah and speak to "mom" like one of the family.  The spry old lady who works as hostess at this restaurant makes me feel like she's welcoming me into her home and kitchen when I come in for my takeout order.  I think I'll eat in next time so I can linger over a pot of tea.  The folks at Wang Wah are good peeps, and they put out simple, good, clean food that's not overly loaded with salt.  If it's not spicy enough for you, add some chili to it yourself.
author: Marvin N.

description: So good, and great deal for your money. You get such great food and combinations when you order anything. Hot & sour soup is amazing, sweet and sour chicken is to die for, and everything of course comes with rice. Staff is very consistent and very nice and accommodating. Great place. you'll love it.
author: Chad W.

description: Very cool chinese restauraunt, the prices are very cheap and the customer service is excellent.  I have always enjoyed the food whenever I have come to eat here and the lettered combo deals are some of the best value in the city.  Highly recommend Golden China!
author: Dillon H.

description: Found myself in the area and was craving Chinese food. I turned to yelp for a good Chinese restaurant and thought I couldn't go wrong with a restaurant who has a review average of four stars. I was wrong. I ordered combination egg rolls, chow mein, general chicken, Mongolian beef, and chicken with steamed vegetables. For $38, the portions were decently sized, but the food is possibly the worst Chinese food I've had in San Francisco. All of the food lacked any flavor. This is what I imagine Chinese food in Nebraska tastes like, not a restaurant on Ocean Avenue. If I didn't hate wasting food so much, I'd throw this away and go get Panda Express. Needless to say, I won't be back.
author: A W.

description:
This evening, I'm making my third visit to Golden China this year and I don't even live in San Francisco.  The food is delicious.  This is one of my favorite Chinese restaurants by far.  (I can't believe the bad reviews.)

If you're looking for ambiance, this is isn't the place.  I say close your eyes and ENJOY.  The little old lady is so sweet; you feel like she's serving you in her home.  She actually brings out one dish at a time!  Its so funny because we try to pace ourselves but the food is so good we can't help ourselves.

My youngest son wouldn't eat anything except Panda Express before, but Golden China made a believer out of him.
author: Judye R.

description: The honey walnut prawns are AMAZING! Great service, nice people, and low prices - can't beat it!
author: Charlotte R.

description: Went to SFSU with friend, and we both were hungry during lunch. Stop by there and ordered chicken wings with shrimp fried rice, my friend ordered Mongolian beef with fried rice. We could not believe it was a big portion and the price was very cheap. You deserve it!
author: Charles S.

description: I love this restaurant, and even happier that it's reopening tomorrow!!! Can't wait to get my number E!! Happy they are back on Ocean Ave.
author: L. M.

description:
Golden China is average-good, inexpensive food in a run-down kinda restaurant.  Normally that's my cup'o'tea but I've only been to this joint once.  

Why?  Because on our first trip, we ordered 2 plates to eat there and 1 to go.  We ate, paid, took our to-go and left.  Then when he went back the next week with his roomie, the waitress told him he she forgot to add our to-go order to the check on our first trip and charged him for it!  Wtf?!  I think I'd have noticed if there was something on the bill missing... he paid because he wasn't sure and didn't want any problems.

That's bad business.  We haven't been back.  We might end up back one day because it's in his neighborhood but, I hope if we do our experience is much better.  I want to like it...

Might see ya there.
author: Susan D.

description: Traditional southern Chinese , family style home food feeling. Cheap price with good food. I and my parents always go for lunch, 3 selections with rice ,soup , tax, total $20.00 + tips. What do you expect? Their name is Kam Wah, not Wang Wah
author: Simon I.

description: I couldn't even consider eating the food I ordered here. Do NOT order the General Tsos or Sweet and Sour chicken, they look absolutely repulsive. We also ordered crab rangoon but got egg rolls instead. Worthless.
author: Ryan T.

description: This used to be my favorite place to eat when I lived in the area. My favorite thing to get was the spicy salty porkchops and salty fish fried rice. Soooo good. And the lady that owns was always so nice she always knew what I wanted.
author: Camille C.

description:
The one star is for the cheap prices. 
 
I don't know what the people who are giving this place 4 or 5 stars are smoking, but you guys need to get out more often! The portions are large but the food is truly disgusting, it slimey and sticky without any real flavor to it! The place is dirty and really sketchy lookin. I found a couple of hairs on our table. No matter how broke I was, I would never go back. I felt nauseous for a couple of hours after eating the food. Never again!!
author: Amela A.

description:
Big portions of average food for cheap price. 
Definitely NOT the hidden gem restaurant you're hoping it to be, but a place to go if you have to. The food is not that bad.
I believe there are better options on Ocean.
author: Liz H.

description:
HELLLA BIG ASS PLATES, especially the chow mein/chow fun...
HELLLA CHEAP, one plate with rice can definitely feed two for less than 10 bucks.
HELLLA YUMMY SALT AND PEPPER FISH. Not on the menu, but they make it for you anyways upon request. I would go here ONLY for that dish...

DOWNFALLS:
1) Food takes FOREVER to come out and not just because I get impatient when I'm hungry but it really takes forever. They handle high traffic of take out orders so I think that's the issue. Three times I've been here and three times I've had to wait 30 minutes or so to get food when the place is practically empty... 
2) Don't get sweet and sour stuff, it's like deep fried meats and the just drop a whole bunch of the packaged sweet and sour sauce on top of your food. 
3) Also, once I ordered walnut prawns and they forgot the walnuts!
4) I love tea, and I think they are real stingy with the tea because when I asked to refill my pot she didn't replace the tea bag so I was drinking hot water basically....
author: Linda N.

description:
I can't say enough nice things about this place!

I really wish I had gotten the woman's name who was working the front, because she has to be by far one of the sweetest and most thoughtful waitresses I've ever had the pleasure of being around.  She was the only one waiting tables, and she also took the phone orders and rang everyone up.  Everything she said was accompanied by a genuine smile and friendly conversation, and more often than not, she'd notice and deliver to our table something we needed before we could even make a request for it.

Our food was fantastic!  We ordered the potstickers, cashew chicken, mongolian beef, and walnut prawns.  It took a bit for our food to come out, but nothing out of the ordinary.  It came out hot and fresh, I feel silly pointing out that I could taste the actual freshness, but it really stood out for me-- the vegetables were crisp and delicious, and I hate vegetables!

The price was very reasonable as well-- 30 bucks for four really large plates of food, all of it yummy.  We'll definitely be back, and I'll be sure to get that sweet woman's name!
author: Tamara N.

description:
I've been back two more times.  Won tons keep pulling.  The last time, my third, the nice lady who is always there said, "You like your won ton soup!", to which I said "No, I like *your* won ton soup" and we both smiled and had a little moment.  

I really like this place.  It is also clearly something of a community center.  I'm still figuring that one out but it's cool.
author: Goolie G.

description: Wow, I don't know how this place got 4 stars because there is really nothing good in here. First of all, the food wasn't good at all. The chicken that we ordered was too salty and dry. Second, the place was too small that the server's arm was all over my face when she was putting our food on the table. Lastly, customer service is SO BAD! Servers are rude especially if you are not the same race as they are. We asked the servers many times that we were ready to order but they just keep passing by us. This lady put all the plates and forks in front us and didn't even bothered fixing and she hand it like she was mad or something. Then, waiting for our orders took so long and yet they still forgot to give us our rice. Told ALL three servers in the restaurant and again, the wait was too long that I just canceled it. When we got our bill, I wanted to make sure that she didn't charge us for the rice but the writing was in Mandarin/Chinese so I asked her because I don't understand, and she just gave me an attitude, raising her voice telling me which one she charged me. I was asking nicely because I don't understand the writing. So is that what you call customer service?!!! I'm writing this review to save others from this disaster.. There's more Chinese restaurant around that is worth your money, have better service and choices of food but NOT this one.
author: Jeza B.

description:
Prices: the prices at Golden China Restaurant are incredibly low!  Lunch specials start at $4.75 and dinner specials start at $5.25.  I've stuck with the specials and combination plates and I have never spent more than $13 (without gratuity) for two people.  Everything is affordable here.

Portions: the portions are extremely generous.  I can eat far more than the average person so if I think the portions are generous than I'd say you would too. 

Taste: everything I've tried has been good although nothing really stands out.  The past couple of times the fried rice has lacked that oily component you find in most fried rice dishes - but this is a good thing.  I thought the Mongolian beef had too many vegetables and not enough beef.  

Service: the service is definitely on the slow side.  There is usually only one person waiting on all the tables and they're constantly filling to go orders.  You have to be patient and prepare yourself for a wait.  My suggestion would be not to show up starving to death because you'll probably lose your patience quicker that way.  I always keep in mind it's a family ran business...and somehow that seems to increase my patience.

Overall, I would definitely recommend this restaurant.  The food taste good and is priced right.  The service is a bit slow but aside from that I've always been treated well.
author: Bánh B.

description:
A HIDDEN GEM - HOLE IN THE WALL.

i'm chinese, and i know real chinese food when i see it. this place has authentic chinese food and rice plates that are perfect for lunches / dinners for one esp for to-go orders. the two older ladies that work up front at the counter are nice, and as nice as they can be, they dont speak the greatest english either. (so it is a lot easier to bring someone who knows how to speak chinese sometimes)

they also may not LOOK great aesthetically, but this is not what this place is all about. its about the cheap prices and good food that they serve. they also give you HUGE portions where a 6foot dude like me cant even finish. 

lastly, this place is family owned so the cooks are family and the workers are all family there. so don't be intimidated by the way they treat you, thats how chinese people are with family, not always the nicest lol.
author: Kenny L.

description:
This is truly my new neighborhood gem. I came here last week after reviewing the Yelp reviews. We had the beef clay pot with vegetables, duck with bok choy, and fried chicken in some sort of sweet and spicy sauce. It was all extremely delicious (although I'm not a big fan of sweet so the fried chicken didn't necessarily win me over). 

The service is just what you'd expect from a Chinese dive: Asian hospitality. We went here on a Thursday night and the place was packed with only one server/hostess/waiter to help us. 

I highly recommend this place for people who don't want to go through the hassle of getting dressed up and are just looking for GOOD quality food to eat at great prices!
author: Le D.

description: This is my favorite spot for a good Chinese Food Dinner. Wang Wah was closed for thirteen months after a fire on Ocean Ave destroyed five businesses. Finally, it reopened! So glad! The fried prawns & homemade sweet n sour sauce, chicken wings, spare ribs, chicken chow mein, walnut prawns, and broccoli beef are so good! Budget friendly, plenty street parking, and the owners know regulars like me (my order is told to me when I walk in). Love them!!
author: René T.

description: this is my favorite local chinese to-go joint and i've gotten take-out here many times. primarily because they have that special 3 entrees for $21 deal, which is a pretty sweet deal and very economical as the portions lasts me a couple of days. it's just your basic cantonese style fobby mom-n-pop neighborhood restaurant. the food is pretty good for non-fancy home style cantonese food. i wouldnt exactly call this place a hole-in-the-wall like some other reviewers called it. it's probably one notch above it as even tho it's fairly plain in decor and a bit unkempt, it's pretty clean even in the bathroom. (personally i dont like dining in or getting take-out at dirty hole-in-the-wall places even if the food is great.) yes it does have a strange odor, but i attribute that to the funky chinese ingredients they use that's imported from china like black mushrooms, herbs and dried seafood. ;) i chit-chat with the owner every time i go in and she's fairly nice if you try to get to know her. she even gave me some of the yummy soup they cooked for their employees lunch. ;)
author: p f.

description: The worst chinese food in San Francisco by far...never thought I'd start a review that way but well these things happen.  The atmosphere was incredibly dull, no music no sound.  I had a not bad vibe walking into the place, however i help any opinions until i tried the food.  This is not a hole in the wall hit, it was awful.  The egg flour soup was mainly broth and tofu, not a whole lot of eggs.  The orange chicken was incredibly tasteless and the majority of the plate was rice.  The pot stickers were horrible.  I will never return and am actually sad I wasted a dinner here.  Don't make the same mistake i made...Panda Express is better than here lol.
author: Tavis I.

description: Don't let the ghetto exterior fool you. This place is legit. It's good for your money, and they have almost anything that comes to your mind when you think... I want Chinese food.
author: Tiff C.

description:
Big portions of GARBAGE! By far the greasiest most disgusting excuse of Chinese food. Yelp you have failed me!

I was hungry before class so I looked to Yelp for help. After reading the reviews of this place I thought it was safe to try. The place is definitely a hole in the wall. It had that dirty Chinese sticky table feeling to it. But I was willing to look pass all this, because Asian places aren't always the cleanliest  :[ But some have good food. This place on the other hand is absolutely gross. The only redeeming thing about this place is the nice little asian lady who greets you. But she can't cook! So don't come 

I will never come back
author: Tess R.

description:
I love love love this place!
They give you huge portions to go and the lady is really really nice.
Everytime me and my boyfriend walk in she immediately says "B&H" for the to go combos we get. Its not too expensive and its delicious! Definitely stop by!
author: Alyssa D.

description:
My wife and I tried this place the other day after hitting the gym. Not only was the food better than the average "cheap chinese greasy spoon", the portions were plenty for both of us to bring out lunch to work the next day.

I especially remember that the beef was actually decent and not just gristle bits in my beef and broccoli. I wouldn't exactly put this place on the list of places to take out of town guests to enjoy but it's definitely on my list of cheap places for a weekday evening meal (plus lunch the next day).

-g
author: Gunn S.

description: I came this past Friday with a coworker for lunch. I ordered the roast duck noodle soup. The duck was decent not the noodles were "meh". Anyway, I guess this is not the place known for soup noodles anyway. Probably their family style entrees or even the chow mein is probably better. In fact I re all I may have eaten here years ago ordering a few entrees and it was good. Prices are inexpensive, but nothing fancy about the decor.
author: H K.

description:
Yelp, you steered me wrong on this one. 

While this restaurant is cheap and serves huge portions, the foods not great and the place is kinda sketch.

I'll give it the benefit of the doubt since I've only eaten here once and give it three stars, but I doubt I'll be back.
author: Murphy O.

description:
Ah, Golden China! This place is SOO AWESOME. When my boyfriend or I were ever sick, we would always buy the Chicken WON TON SOUP! It's always so delicious, and the won-tons are alway so soft and desolve in your tounge.

Yummy.

It is true, that the waitress (who's daughter went to my middle school and high school) does remember your orders. Whenever I call for a pick up, I say, "Chicken won ton and egg rolls" then she says "Ah, you're Mary's (her daughter) friend" 

They're completely family owned and operated = AWESOME
I like to leave big tips =)
author: Sophia G.

description:
Won who runs the whole operation is a tough woman who works 7 days a week. she won't laugh at  your jokes but will get you your order in like 10 minutes and what more can you ask for? 

my brothers and i have been coming in for years and when i get roped into walking down and picking up the orders (read: PAY FOR) she knows exactly who i am and what i am ordering. this proves particularly impressive when i walk through the door without ordering yet and she yells out "mongolian chicken and rice, 5 minutes."

huge portions
author: Samantha G.

description: Not much to rave about from the street or in the dining room, but the food is really, really good. And the people are sweet. It's like being in your grandmother's kitchen, very small and wonderful-smelling, with women busy stuffing little dumplings. We loved the duck, and the chicken wonton soup is definitely comfort food (great also for when you have a cold). Prices are incredibly low! This is a family favorite for takeout.
author: Felicia S.

description: To all my ballers on a budget and homies like kites, I got one things to say to yaz: "A - F all day every day!" Was introduced to this spot waaay back when I used to attend CCSF as it is a few blocks away and it  hits the spot every time. I would suggest being open-minded as this diamond in the ruff is NOT for the softies so try not to get caught up in the decore or try to make it into elaborate experience cause either way, they will serve you mighty good if you catch my drift...
author: Dennes H.

description:
I've been eating at this place FOREVER...don't trust the haters...there's a reason for all of the 4/5 star ratings - cuz the food is dirt-cheap (and HUGE servings) & is the ISHNIT!!!!

I think it's the  "G" plate that's the Shimp Lover's lil bit of heaven; it comes with sweet & sour prawns, broccoli shrimp, shrimp fried rice & an eggroll...the broccoli is just the right amount of crispness, & the shrimp burst in your mouth, they're so fresh.  I'm happy, the kids are full - winner!!!
author: Amoura B.

description: 4 Stars for take-out, it's good and you get a lot of food. The sweet and sour sauce has a delicious and sweet lemony zing to it. Mushu Pork was really good, and the combo's are really great deals (2-3 meals in one depending on your appetite). Dinning in isn't fancy but the food is great and they are pretty fast with food and drinks.
author: Jen O.

description: Ehh, went here 'cause of positive yelp reviews. Sub-par food, the lady who waited on me was rude as hell, wouldn't even give me a 2nd ramiken of chili sauce, give me a break, long wait too, only one waitress/hostess/receptionist/cashier. Portions are big though.
author: Michael V.

description:
It's the return of the old dirty chinese restaurant review.

They're hole in the walls.
They're family run.
They're a little grimey.
They're cheap.
And they're goood.

I go for the Specialty boxes that even a toddler can easily order.  They are conveniently labled (A - H).  

I usually go for a B (egg roll, 2 fried prawns, bbq pork fried rice, beef broccoli).

But then I also like G (egg roll, 2 fried prawns, shrimp fried rice, beef broccoli).

Or I can go chicken crazy with C (2 fried chicken wings, cashew nut chicken, chicken chow mein)!

The food can be a little salty, so I tell the nice old lady.  "Siu yeam, please"; which translates to "hey ma, i don't want that msg jibba jabba in my pork fried rice, you dig??"  And she says nicely, "ok".  Now, she knows that I like it that way and I don't even have to ask.  Cha-ching!

Three stars because, you probably already have an old dirty chinese restaurant somewhere around your area.
author: Sam T.

description: love love this place!!!  I have been here twice (the first time was in January when we went to visit my best friend- she recommended that we eat this place, and she ate here for her birthday based on all the yelp reviews) yeah, it's not in the best part of SF, but usually those hole in the wall places have some of the best Chinese stuff.  Yummm.  I love the orange chicken, sweet and sour pork, and Chinese broccoli with oyster sauce.  It is very reasonably priced too.  Maybe the next time me and my boyfriend visit SF I can sweetly convince him to have dinner here again :)
author: Hannah P.

description:
My dad has been eating here for over 20 years and I have been eating here since he introduced the fam about 10 years ago. 

Our no-fail menu:

Westlake Beef Soup
Fried Shrimp
Fried Wontons
Fish with Black Bean Sauce and String Beans (it's not on the menu per-se.... you have to ask for it like I do! the mom is super nice and will probably put in the order for you if you're nice =)
Box B (BBQ Pork fried rice with a smidgeon of beef with broccoli, 2 pieces of fried shrimp and one eggroll - a lunch special we share as a family)

Can take a while to get your food but hey! there's only one cook (the father of the family who owns the restaurant) and one sous-chef (the sister of the wife), one waitress (the wife) and their parents who help in preparing the food! 

It also gets busy at lunch time which is awesome because more people should come here for a satisfying lunch! 

Also found out my friend is their daughter which is very cool.

Love this place =)
author: Christine C.

description:
First time I ate here was today and for the first time I was commanded to, Hurry up and Finish my Food at a restaurant! That's so RUDE!! What if I choked or something? They would be held liable!! 

I understand the restaurant is packed during lunch hour but you shouldn't drive your customers away because you want your "loyal customers" to eat there. I noticed the crowd that eats there were construction workers or maintenance workers.  Some students of course, since it is close to CCSF.  My friend and I ordered the Chicken Curry and Mongolian Beef.  The chicken curry was pretty good! I forgot the pricing on it but it was for sure around between $5-$6.  As for the Mongolian Beef it was $4.95 and it was a huge plate serving also! The Mongolian Beef did not taste like it at all.  It was for sure spicier than usual but my main complaint was the taste of the sauce.  Mongolian beef is suppose to be darker but the one we had was a little lighter as if it had BBQ sauce on it.  But the taste was like it was mixed with Jalapeños and Ketchup! What on earth! Why does my Mongolian beef taste like ketchup? But a friend said it was Hoisin Sauce. But I felt they overpowered it with the Hoisin! Their rice seemed like it wasn't cooked properly cause it was too hard. Gross! Who likes their rice hard? I gave them 2 stars because of the cheap pricing and the convenience of the school being close by and the residents. Anyway, I wouldn't mind coming here again because of their cheap pricing and large plates.  

But the things they need to work on is their MANNERS!
author: Sharjah M.

description:
I've been coming here for as long as I can remember.  The lady that works the front/back remembers my dad and calls me "little girl", even tho I am in my mid 20's lol.  I get the Beef Chow Mein with Broccoli.  My husband usually gets the Beef Chow Fun.  Westlake Beef Soup is tasty too.  

We just moved back to the City of SF, and Golden China is only a 5 minute drive.  YES!  Back to my roots!
author: Alice E.

description: This Chinese hole-in-the-wall is crazier than most of the Chinese diners I've visited in this city. For one thing, I've seen Chinese men sit and drink Heineken beer from a 12-can case that sat on their table. I'm pretty sure this restaurant does not have a liquor license. Cleanliness? No, if that's important to you. I know to discreetly wipe down the table and utensils when I go there. On one visit they actually served tea in a dirty teapot that had a chunk of dried food stuck to the outside of it. The caption on one of the photos says all rice is free, yet I am always charged for rice when I order their yummy vegetable egg foo yung that comes with really tasty gravy. I've also tried the  mongolian beef, but it wasn't very good. The service has never been great, but sometimes it is so slow you have to wonder if they're making too much money to care. Even though they close at 9:00 p.m., don't go in after 7:30 because they are worn out by then and let you know they don't really want to serve you. Again, lots of craziness here! Why do I keep going back? Few better options in the neighborhood.
author: Reynolds L.

description: Love this place. Use to go all the time. The food is good and the super cheap! Its owned by an old chinese couple who are really sweet. Service is a little slow, but I think its worth it. Its good for small groups.
author: Kristin S.

description:
I will admit, I'm bias for this restaurant because my cousins own it. I hardly ever visit though, because they always charge me very little. Even without their discount, the cost for a meal is still cheap. They give you a lot of food that will definitely fill you.
Good place to go to for a quick, cheap meal.
author: Henry D.

description: A friend had said she'd been there in the past and wasn't impressed. I'm not sure if she's snootier than myself or went there on a bad day, but I was quite satisfied. The food was real good for the price and the little old lady who helped us was super sweet. Atmosphere is a bit dingy, but that's not a deal breaker for me and fresh, tasty food at a good price makes it more than worth it for me.
author: Nate P.

description:
Sorry, it's really hard to give a nice old lady a 2-star review, but I have to do it.

Food wasn't that great. The sweet and sour chicken was really bad in my opinion, and that is a huge no-no in my book. The food was plentiful, but not as much as locations nearby (Wong's Cafe, yum). Pot stickers were also horrible. I did think that the fried rice was pretty damn good though, but even I can make that at home.

It was a little dirty but I have never minded that (I eat at a lot of hole in the walls), so that isn't why it's getting 2 stars. If spot free cleanliness is a huge concern of yours though, I'm sure you'd be weary eating here.
author: Aaron M.

description: I always order their soups (like westlake and wonton) every time I stay over my cousins place. Their soups have that comfort food taste; the kind of soups that calms you down after a hectic day. I've tried their other main dishes and they're good, but I think their secret weapons are the awesome soups! I suggest the westlake or wonton soups... They're very tasty.
author: Clifford P.

description:
The food is quite mediocre, I wouldn't order from Golden China again. We've tried 2 types of shrimp, ribs, and hot and sour soup.

Out of all of them, rice was average, everything was below average, except for the soup, which was atrocious and smelled like toilet water mixed with garbage. I'll be staying away.
author: Artem R.

description: Unbelievable! I tried this place tonight and it was absolutely incredible. The beef chow fun and prawns and crispy walnuts were our favorite dishes. Each dish was on average 6 bucks a piece. The portions were excellent and quality was surprising for how inexpensive it was.
author: David L.

description: Worst chinese food I've ever had, that's saying a lot
author: Mike B.

description: It's true, it doesn't look like much on the outside, or on the inside for that matter, and they're always playing some kind of Chinese soap opera on the little TV on the counter but the food is good and cheap! They have a lot of combo plates to choose from, which is a total bonus because I do a fair amount of solo eating and I like to have a variety of food without having a ton of leftovers. Hint: look beyond the lettered combos and you'll find a section in the menu called "combination food" with a few other choices. My fave is the chicken with mixed veggies and shrimp fried rice. The portions are huge! one combo plate is enough to last me 2 meals!
author: Melanie V.

description:
When it comes to Chinese food this place is a real gem!  Quality is as good as it gets, and the portions are the most generous you will find at very reasonable prices.  You cannot go wrong ordering any of the noodle dishes and has the least amount of grease except for the boxed lunch specials.  I have yet to see any burnt noodles here, and the veggies are cooked nice and soft.

I have to assume the negative reviews I read must pertain to their boxed lunch specials which I never order because all their cook-to-order items are first rate.

Waitress is super nice.

Only drawback is since they are busy during peak periods and even off-peak periods you can expect a longer wait for your food.  Golden China has a long list of regulars for a very good reason and isn't the place to go to if you're in a hurry.
author: Ed L.

description:
Just got home from Golden China and I am IMPRESSED! HUGE portions and great prices!

This is my new stock chinese place in SF.
author: mike b.

description: This is the epitome of a "hole in the wall". It isn't much to look at and It was even a little cold inside with very limited seating area but once the food comes, the fun starts. The cost was better than reasonable and the food was better than good. We'll be going there again.
author: Richard Q.

description: Cheap price. Not too clean, no decoration,  Not everything is good. We always order things not on the menu. (steam talapia with ginger&green onion, sweet potato leaf with shrimp paste or bean curb. Taro and preserve duck. Just like homemade) and the house soup is awesome.
author: uncle m.

description:
Come here if:
a)  You are with family who cannot fathom eating any meal that is not a traditional Cantonese style dinner
b)  You are obligated to take people out and want quality at a bargain
c)  a and b

We ordered three dishes(snow peas + string beans with chicken, snow pea tips, mushroom with Chinese bok choy) for $22.

None of the dishes tasted too salty or greasy.  Some tips of the leafs of the veggies were overcooked, but not extremely so.

The waitress is also quite friendly and was the only one waiting on tables when I went.  Hard not to root for that.

Bottom line:  I would come here again.
author: Stephen N.

description:
It makes me joyous to see a shitload of food in front of me.

Lunch specials rule. So do dinner specials.
author: AJ C.

description:
I live two blocks above Golden China so I frequently come here either for family dinners or for occasional takeouts. I personally think the food is very good at such a cheap price. The portions are insanely big, so you can probably feed two small individuals with each dish (particularly the rice plates). 

What I recommend there is getting the Kung Pao Chicken rice place. I like how that is not too spicy to burn a hole in my esophagus, but enough to keep me on the edge. My mom knows how good the dish is. She orders that every single time we go there and she has eaten Chinese food her whole life.

When I go there for family dinners, My parents have brought seafood from the outside and the restaurant owner was happy to cook the it for us. Not sure if that is extended to all customers since we are regular customers.

Overall if you are looking for cheap food, go here!
author: Hilland C.

description: I think they put crack in their fried rice because once you start, you can't stop.
author: Henry C.

description: The sweetest lady works there with a beautiful smile :), she is what will keep me coming back.  The food tastes pretty fresh as well, with good portions.
author: Bobby L.

description: this is my favorite "hole in the wall" Chinese food place in San Francisco.  Call ahead to place your order since you don't really go here to sit down and eat...it's a take-out place.  The prices are good.  The combinations are around $5-6 and you get a lot of food with it.  last time, i ordered a combination for my boyfriend and an order of chow fun and honey walnut prawn and it cost me just under $20.  This is the place to go if you want some great chinese food.
author: Sonya T.

description: Service is not the fastest but alright. On a day when dungess crab is 2.99 from the chinese grocery store, its 12.99 here with garlic and scallions. Not bad. Screw PPQ and those other rip off places. The food here in general is inexpensive and not the highest quality, just very average ingredients. But the cook it alright. This is the kind of place you can eat every weekend, but not a place you'd go to for special occasions. Having said that I'd come back again. They also give good size portions of food.
author: Dijon Y.

description: I have tried virtually every other Chinese food place in the city (is that possible! haha) The best! The family that own this place is really nice. I went to school with there children
author: Donald W.

description: Very good service  exceptional foods, this will be our lunch place, best values In San Francisco!!!!!!
author: Mike D.

description:
it's always a bummer to read yelp reviews that say how amazing a place is and then come to find out it's nasty...seriously, nasty. one star because yelp leaves me no choice.

ordered egg rolls as an appetizer...tasteless and realllllly greasy but i was starving so ate some anyway. i actually wanted veggie egg rolls which they don't have and when i asked what kind of meat was in the ones they offered she was super hesitant with her answer..hmmm. 

for my entree i ordered the crispy szechuan dinner special..came with steamed rice and soup. the soup came out first.. i went with wonton and apparently i made the wrong decision because the soup was absolutely tasteless (no salt to be found in this place to even try to make it worth anything). hmmm, and as for the mystery stuffing in the wontons themselves? yuck! my two friends and i are under the assumption that it was pork? pork shouldn't be pink, people!

my friends were sharing their food (chicken chow fun-dry, walnut prawns and general tso chicken) which all came out before mine. i decided to look past that since they offered that i try their grub. bleh. general tso was SOOO spicy but bland at the same time. definitely something missing in this dish. one bite of the chow fun and i was done with it, verrrry greasy and once again tasteless. the honey walnut prawns on the other hand were good, i had never had them before.

finally my food came and it was again, BLAND AND TASTELESS yet had an after taste that was like the smell of bathroom cleaner. seemed to be the theme of the night..my friend asked me if i was getting sick or dealing with allergies when her boyfriend cut in and said that he, too, thought it was bland.

nothing worse than crappy service on top of crappy food!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Tess B.

description: This spot's right down the street from me, located about 3 blocks from City College. Hole-in-the-wall. My family and I have been dining here since 2002. The old lady is nice and has been there forever. Their prices are so frikin cheap and the portions are huge. I usually get the "A" combo which I highly recommend. (Chow mein, sweet and sour pork/chicken, and 2 pieces of fried shrimp). They're extremely fast at getting your dish out right after you order (about 5 minutes). Or like I do, you just order 10 minutes ahead, so by the time you come in for take out (or dine in) the food'll already be ready. If she's familiar with you, she'll know your dish right when she see's you or even by calling to order, she'll recognize your voice and already know what you want to order. The place is not all that clean but it's balanced out by the food quality and the prices. There's like 2 spaces of side parking available but you can always park in the Walgreens parking lot right next store to the restaurant. Unless your unusually pick, you'll enjoy it. Definitely a place I'd recommended. I used to eat there 3 to 4 times a week, no lie, but due to the recession....well, you know the rest. =)
author: Aaron F.

description: I am stuffed. I got through what I could of my $5.75 plate. Let me tell you: I feel like I ate 13 dollars worth of food that I would at an upscale restaurant. The portions are rediculously huge for such a rediculously low price. And the food is damn good too!
author: Chris P.

description: Above average chinese food. They had no problem making my chicken and vegetables without oil, and it tasted much healthier than other chinese places I've been to. The perfect topping when I got home for a spinach salad.
author: Jason B.

description: 3.5 stars.  Usually decent food.  Good portions, especially if you become a regular.  Not too expensive.  They can re-arrange for groups.
author: e g.

description: yes, food are great. I order the combination chow mein( prawn, beef, chicken, pork) it tastes good. but I don suggest you going at the busy time such as 12-1 o'clock. it is super busy and it takes about 20 minutes to get my food to go.......
author: Li L.

description: cheap eats !!! good location, parking is okay sometimes, they give you ALOT of food for like 5 bucks
author: Mike Z.

description: fantastic chinese food+super fast service+nice lady that remembers you like a cup of ice with your coke and a fork instead of chopsticks=five stars, most definitely
author: rachface -.

description: i love this place. the lunch prices are pretty cheap, and the food is excellent. though they recently jacked up the prices a few cents, it's still worth it. they give you plenty of food. sometimes i actually asked for an extra bowl of rice just to accommodate all my tomato beef. the family that owns it is really nice. very friendly service. only reason i give it four stars is because the place just looks run down a bit and the recent increase in prices. other than that i don't care too much about the atmosphere because the food is awesome! i introduced many friends to this place and they love it. see you there at wang wah's restaurant.
author: Vincent Y.
